description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国河南省下辖的地级市，是河洛文化和华夏文明的重要发祥地。历史上曾有十三个正统朝代建都于此，是中国历史上建都最早、朝代最多、历时最长的城市之一。
description.en: A prefecture-level city in Henan Province, People's Republic of China, and an important cradle of Heluo culture and Chinese civilization. It served as the capital for thirteen orthodox dynasties, making it one of the cities with the longest history as a capital in China.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国的省份，洛阳市的上级行政区。
description.en: A province of the People's Republic of China, and the superior administrative division of Luoyang City.

description.zh-cn: 中国政治人物，蒙古族，现任中共洛阳市委书记。
description.en: Chinese politician of Mongol ethnicity, currently serving as the CPC Secretary of Luoyang.

nodes.id: 中国共产党洛阳市委员会

zh-cn: 中国共产党洛阳市委员会

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党在洛阳市的地方组织。
description.en: The local organization of the Communist Party of China in Luoyang.

description.zh-cn: 中国政治人物，汉族，现任洛阳市人民代表大会常务委员会主任。
description.en: Chinese politician of Han ethnicity, currently serving as the Chairman of the Standing Committee of the Luoyang Municipal People's Congress.

nodes.id: 洛阳市人民代表大会常务委员会

zh-cn: 洛阳市人民代表大会常务委员会

description.zh-cn: 洛阳市的地方国家权力机关。
description.en: The local organ of state power in Luoyang.

description.zh-cn: 中国政治人物，满族，现任洛阳市人民政府市长。
description.en: Chinese politician of Manchu ethnicity, currently serving as the Mayor of the Luoyang Municipal People's Government.

description.zh-cn: 洛阳市的地方行政机关。
description.en: The local administrative organ of Luoyang.

description.zh-cn: 中国政治人物，汉族，现任中国人民政治协商会议洛阳市委员会主席。
description.en: Chinese politician of Han ethnicity, currently serving as the Chairman of the Luoyang Municipal Committee of the Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference.

nodes.id: 中国人民政治协商会议洛阳市委员会

zh-cn: 中国人民政治协商会议洛阳市委员会

description.zh-cn: 中国人民政治协商会议在洛阳市的地方组织。
description.en: The local organization of the Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference in Luoyang.

description.zh-cn: 古代连接东西方的商贸路线，以东汉首都洛阳为东方起点。
description.en: An ancient network of trade routes connecting the East and West, with its eastern starting point in Luoyang, the capital of the Eastern Han dynasty.

description.zh-cn: 东汉时期著名军事家、外交家，开辟了丝绸之路。
description.en: A famous military strategist and diplomat of the Eastern Han Dynasty who helped establish the Silk Road.

description.zh-cn: 东汉时期人物，奉班超之命出使大秦，是第一位到达波斯湾的中国使者，为丝绸之路的开辟做出贡献。
description.en: An individual from the Eastern Han Dynasty, sent by Ban Chao on a mission to Daqin. He was the first Chinese envoy to reach the Persian Gulf, contributing to the establishment of the Silk Road.

description.zh-cn: 隋朝第二位皇帝，于605年下令营建东都洛阳。
description.en: The second emperor of the Sui dynasty, who ordered the construction of the eastern capital, Luoyang, in 605.

description.zh-cn: 隋唐时期的都城，由隋炀帝下令营建，其城市格局对日本京都等城市产生了影响。
description.en: The capital city during the Sui and Tang dynasties, built under the order of Emperor Yang of Sui. Its urban layout influenced cities such as Kyoto in Japan.

description.zh-cn: 日本城市，别名洛阳，其古代都城平安京的格局仿照唐朝洛阳城建立。
description.en: A city in Japan, also known as Rakuyō (洛阳). Its ancient capital, Heian-kyō, was modeled after Luoyang of the Tang dynasty.

description.zh-cn: 日本城市，其古代都城平城京仿照汉魏洛阳城建造。
description.en: A city in Japan. Its ancient capital, Heijō-kyō, was modeled after the city of Luoyang of the Han-Wei dynasties.

description.zh-cn: 东汉、曹魏、西晋、北魏等朝代的都城遗址，其格局影响了日本奈良的平城京。
description.en: The archaeological site of the capital city for dynasties such as the Eastern Han, Cao Wei, Western Jin, and Northern Wei. Its layout influenced Heijō-kyō in Nara, Japan.

description.zh-cn: 中国史书中记载的第一个世袭制朝代，曾以斟𬩽（今洛阳二里头遗址）为都。
description.en: The first hereditary dynasty in Chinese history, which had its capital at Zhenxun (modern-day Erlitou site in Luoyang).

description.zh-cn: 中国古代朝代，以雒阳（今洛阳）为都城。
description.en: An ancient Chinese dynasty with its capital at Luoyang.

description.zh-cn: 西晋时期著名文学家，其作品《三都赋》曾造成“洛阳纸贵”的现象。
description.en: A famous writer of the Western Jin dynasty, whose work 'Three Capitals Rhapsody' caused the phenomenon known as 'Paper is dear in Luoyang'.

description.zh-cn: 西晋文学家左思的代表作，因广受欢迎而导致当时洛阳纸价上涨。
description.en: The representative work of the Western Jin writer Zuo Si, which was so popular that it caused the price of paper in Luoyang to rise.

description.zh-cn: 东周时期洛阳人，著名纵横家，与典故“悬梁刺股”、“前倨后恭”相关。
description.en: A famous strategist from Luoyang during the Eastern Zhou period, associated with the idioms 'suspend oneself by the hair to the beam and jab one's thigh with an awl' and 'arrogant before, deferential after'.

description.zh-cn: 武周开国君主，将洛阳命名为“神都”。相传曾因牡丹不从其令而将其贬至洛阳。
description.en: The founding monarch of the Wu Zhou dynasty, who named Luoyang 'Shendu' (Divine Capital). Legend has it that she exiled the peony to Luoyang for disobeying her command.

description.zh-cn: 一种著名的观赏植物，被誉为“花中之王”，洛阳牡丹尤为著名。
description.en: A famous ornamental plant, known as the 'King of Flowers'. The peonies of Luoyang are particularly renowned.

description.zh-cn: 洛阳市下辖的市辖区，洛阳市人民政府驻地。
description.en: A municipal district under the jurisdiction of Luoyang City, and the seat of the Luoyang Municipal People's Government.

description.zh-cn: 洛阳市是河南省下辖的地级市。
description.en: Luoyang is a prefecture-level city under the jurisdiction of Henan Province.

description.zh-cn: 洛龙区是洛阳市下辖的市辖区。
description.en: Luolong District is a municipal district under the jurisdiction of Luoyang City.

relationships.target: 中国共产党洛阳市委员会

description.zh-cn: 陈春江自2023年10月起担任中共洛阳市委书记。
description.en: Chen Chunjiang has served as the Secretary of the CPC Luoyang Municipal Committee since October 2023.

relationships.target: 洛阳市人民代表大会常务委员会

description.zh-cn: 李保国自2023年1月起担任洛阳市人民代表大会常务委员会主任。
description.en: Li Baoguo has served as the Chairman of the Standing Committee of the Luoyang Municipal People's Congress since January 2023.

description.zh-cn: 张玉杰自2024年3月起担任洛阳市人民政府市长。
description.en: Zhang Yujie has served as the Mayor of the Luoyang Municipal People's Government since March 2024.

relationships.target: 中国人民政治协商会议洛阳市委员会

description.zh-cn: 孙延文自2023年1月起担任中国人民政治协商会议洛阳市委员会主席。
description.en: Sun Yanwen has served as the Chairman of the Luoyang Municipal Committee of the Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference since January 2023.

description.zh-cn: 班超是开辟丝绸之路的关键人物之一。
description.en: Ban Chao was one of the key figures in establishing the Silk Road.

description.zh-cn: 甘英奉班超之命出使大秦，为丝绸之路的开辟做出贡献。
description.en: Gan Ying, under Ban Chao's orders, embarked on a mission to Daqin, contributing to the establishment of the Silk Road.

description.zh-cn: 洛阳是古代丝绸之路的东方起点。
description.en: Luoyang was the eastern starting point of the ancient Silk Road.

description.zh-cn: 605年，隋炀帝下令营建东都，即隋唐洛阳城。
description.en: In 605, Emperor Yang of Sui ordered the construction of the Eastern Capital, which became the Sui-Tang Luoyang City.

description.zh-cn: 日本京都的城市设计仿照了唐朝东都洛阳的格局。
description.en: The urban design of Kyoto, Japan, was modeled after the layout of Luoyang, the eastern capital of the Tang dynasty.

description.zh-cn: 日本奈良的平城京仿照汉魏洛阳城建造。
description.en: Heijō-kyō in Nara, Japan, was built in imitation of the Han-Wei era Luoyang city.

description.zh-cn: 夏朝以斟𬩽（位于今洛阳市境内的二里头遗址）为都城。
description.en: The Xia dynasty established its capital at Zhenxun (the Erlitou site, located within modern Luoyang).

description.zh-cn: 东汉以雒阳（今洛阳市）为都城。
description.en: The Eastern Han dynasty established its capital at Luoyang.

description.zh-cn: 左思创作了文学名篇《三都赋》。
description.en: Zuo Si created the famous literary work 'Three Capitals Rhapsody'.

description.zh-cn: 《三都赋》在西晋时期广受欢迎，导致当时洛阳的纸张价格飞涨，形成了“洛阳纸贵”的典故。
description.en: The 'Three Capitals Rhapsody' was so popular during the Western Jin dynasty that it caused the price of paper in Luoyang to skyrocket, leading to the idiom 'Paper is dear in Luoyang'.

description.zh-cn: 684年9月，武则天将东都洛阳命名为“神都”。
description.en: In September 684, Wu Zetian named the eastern capital Luoyang 'Shendu' (Divine Capital).

description.zh-cn: 相传武则天寒冬令百花绽放，唯牡丹不从，于是将其贬至洛阳并下令火烧牡丹。
description.en: According to legend, Wu Zetian ordered all flowers to bloom in winter. Only the peony disobeyed, so she exiled it to Luoyang and ordered it to be burned.
